definition: to tie on/to buckle up/to fasten
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)

sentences.english: Men should wear a collared, long-sleeve white shirt with a conservative tie.
sentences.chinese: 男士應穿着白色有領長袖襯衫，並繫上領帶。

sentences.english: But is she very ill?' I asked, flinging down my rake and tying my bonnet.
sentences.chinese: “她的病很嚴重嗎？”我問道，扔下耙子，繫上帽子。

sentences.english: Then he fastened a torch to every pair of tails.
sentences.chinese: 然後，他在每一對尾巴上繫上一支火把。

sentences.english: Please attach labels to all your bags.
sentences.chinese: 請你把所有的包上都繫上標籤。

sentences.english: As I see it, all motorists should wear seat belts.
sentences.chinese: 依我看，汽車司機都應繫上安全帶。

sentences.english: Trevor, let me tie your shoelace.
sentences.chinese: 特雷福，讓我幫你把鞋帶繫上吧。

sentences.english: Tie up the long carrot slice on the cabbage roll as ribbon. Serve with dipping sauce.
sentences.chinese: 繫上胡蘿蔔絲即可配合沾醬擺盤上桌。

sentences.english: The tourist attached labels to all his bags.
sentences.chinese: 旅遊者把他的行李都繫上標籤。

sentences.english: A tag was attached to each article.
sentences.chinese: 每件物品上都繫上了標籤。

sentences.english: There is a white ribbon on every branch.
sentences.chinese: 每根樹枝都繫上了白絲帶。

sentences.english: Now the driver and the front-seat passenger are required to wear safety belts.
sentences.chinese: 現在司機和前座乘客必須繫上安全帶。

sentences.english: The police belted up and went out.
sentences.chinese: 差人繫上皮帶，走了出去。

sentences.english: They go out into the middle of the river on a boat, tie themselves to a rope and dive in.
sentences.chinese: 他們坐船行使到河中央，身上繫上繩子跳進河中。

sentences.english: Lace up some comfortable shoes, put your pooch on his leash and move those legs.
sentences.chinese: 穿上舒適的鞋子，給狗繫上皮帶，然後邁動雙腿。

sentences.english: Harnesses are also attached on the riders to allow for a safer travel experience.
sentences.chinese: 騎自行車的人也要繫上揹帶，保證騎行時候的安全。
